sentences.sContent: The heat and the champagne made him feel dizzy .
sentences.sCn: 高温和香槟酒使他感到眩晕。

sentences.sContent: She started to suffer from dizzy spells (= a short period when you feel dizzy ) .
sentences.sCn: 她开始感到一阵阵的眩晕。

synos.tran: 晕眩的；使人头晕的；昏乱的；心不在焉的；愚蠢的
使头晕眼花；使混乱；使茫然

words.tran: 使人眼花地；头昏眼花地

remMethod.val: di(二) ＋ zz(打鼾声) ＋ y → 室友打鼾， 让人失眠 → 眩晕的

trans.tranCn: 晕眩的；昏乱的；使人发晕或困惑的
trans.tranOther: feeling unable to stand steadily, for example because you are looking down from a high place or because you are ill
